page.title: 15COPPICE FARM
page.content: {Coppice Farm}is near{Ratlinghope. The name of the farmer who owns it is {Mr Cooke.}The farm has been in his family for 300 years. The top land is called{permanent {pasture.Old Land's Wood}is{rough {grazing}and the{Spring Coppice was cleared in 1930.All that land belongs to Mr Cooke.The total area of the farm is 121 Hectares. There are 500 breeding Ewes, 60 Cows and 10 Calves. The main farm buildings are the cattle shed and hay barn. Mr and Mrs Cooke and two casual labourers are the people who work on the farm.The main pieces of machinery are:3 tractors,1 baler and 1 forage harvester,used for silage. Some of the problems farming in the area include the steep slopes and the altitude-they are 1000' above sea-level.
